item.title: Diaries of Tom Turley - First entry
item.description: Mother was crying again. She tried to be quiet, but I heard. I will never get used to the sound. Why can’t they just be happy? They must have found each other for a reason. I wonder if they had it better before me. Father came to say goodnight. He sat on my bedside, telling me one of his stories. His gaze wavered from my face often. Through the window he watched the sea.
